All Classes

Class Description
Ability
The Ability enum is used to represent various abilities that entities can possess in the game.
Abxervyer
The Abxervyer class represents a boss enemy named Abxervyer in the game.
Action
Base class for Actions.
ActionList
A thin wrapper for java.util.ArrayList<Action> that does not allow nulls to be added.
ActivateSkill
The ActivateSkill interface defines the contract for objects that can be activated and deactivated as skills.
ActivateSkillAction
The ActivateSkillAction class represents an action that allows an actor to activate or reactivate an implementor of the ActivateSkill interface.
Actor
The Actor class represents a GameEntity that can perform an Action.
ActorAttribute<T>
An interface that represents an attribute of an actor.
ActorAttributeOperations  
ActorLocationsIterator
Represents a bimap of locations and actors.
ActorType
An enumeration representing different types of actors in the game.
Application  
Application  
Application
The main class to start the game.
AttackAction
An Action that represents an attack performed by an Actor on another Actor using a specified Weapon.
AttackBehaviour
The AttackBehaviour class represents a behavior where an actor attempts to attack nearby actors of a specified target type.
BaseActorAttribute
A class that represents a basic attribute of an actor, such as health.
BaseActorAttributes

Created by:
BehaviourPriority  
Blacksmith
The Blacksmith class represents a non-moving actor in the game, denoted by the character 'B'.
Bloodberry
The bloodberry class represents the bloodberry item, which is a consumable item which can be used in order to increase the player's maximum health by 5
Broadsword
The Broadsword class represents a type of weapon item in the game that can be used for attacks and has a focus skill.
Bug  
Bush
The Bush class represents a special type of ground that can spawn enemy actors based on the specified actor type.
CapabilitySet
A collection of Capability objects.
Consumable
The Consumable interface represents items that can be consumed by an actor.
ConsumeAction
The IncreaseStaminaAction class represents an action where an actor can increase their maximum stamina.

Dirt
A class that represents bare dirt.
Display
Class that manages I/O for the system
DoNothingAction
An Action that doesn't do anything.
DrinkPuddleAction
The DrinkPuddleAction class represents an action which can be performed while an actor is on a puddle tile
DropAction
An action for dropping an item from the actor's inventory.
Droppable  
DroppedRuneManager
The DroppedRuneManager class manages the dropped runes in a game environment.
EldentreeGuardian
The EldentreeGuardian class represents an enemy type in the game with special capabilities.
EldentreeGuardianSpawner
The EldentreeGuardianSpawner class is responsible for spawning an EldentreeGuardian at a given location based on a specified probability.
EmptyHut
The EmptyHut class represents a special type of ground that can spawn enemy actors based on the specified actor type.
Enemy  
Exit
Class that represents a route from one Location to another.
FancyGroundFactory
Class that can create different types of Ground based on the character that represents it.

Floor  
Floor
A class that represents the floor inside a building.
FocusSkill
The FocusSkill class represents a skill that can be activated by an actor, providing enhancements to a Broadsword weapon.
FollowBehaviour
A class that figures out a MoveAction that will move the actor one step closer to a target Actor.
FollowBehaviour
A class that figures out a MoveAction that will move the actor one step closer to a target Actor.
ForestKeeper
The ForestKeeper class represents a type of actor in the game, specifically a hostile enemy character known as a Forest Keeper.
ForestKeeperSpawner
The ForestKeeperSpawner class is responsible for spawning a ForestKeeper at a given location based on weather conditions.
GameEntity
Base class for all objects that can exist in the game.
GameMap
Class representing one map within the system.
Gate
The Gate class represents a special ground type in the game, which acts as a gate to connect two different GameMaps.
GiantHammer
A class representing a Giant Hammer weapon in the game.
Graveyard
The Graveyard class represents a special type of ground that can spawn enemy actors based on the specified actor type.
GreatKnife
A class representing a Great Knife weapon in the game.
GreatSlamSkill
A class representing the Great Slam skill action in the game.
Ground
Class representing terrain type
GroundFactory
Interface for factory classes used by GameMap to create new map locations.
HealingVial
The HealingVial class represents a healing item that can be used by actors to restore their health.
HollowSoldier
The HollowSoldier class represents a type of actor in the game, specifically a hostile enemy character known as a Hollow Soldier.
HollowSoldierSpawner
The HollowSoldier class is responsible for spawning a HollowSoldier at a given location based on a specified probability.

Item
Abstract base class representing a physical object in the game world.
ItemCapability
An enumeration representing different item capabilities in the game.

LivingBranchSpawner
The LivingBranchSpawner class is responsible for spawning a LivingBranch enemy at a given location based on a specified probability.

Class representing a location in the game map.

Maps
The Maps class contains static fields representing map layouts for different in-game locations.

A menu GUI implementations
MonologueAction
The MonologueAction class handles all actions with actors that have monologues.
MoveActorAction
An Action that moves the Actor.
NumberRange
A class that represents an array of sequential numbers.

The OldKey class represents an item that can be used as an old key in the game.

An action for picking up an item from the ground.

Class representing the Player.
Player
Class representing the Player.
PlayerCondition
The PlayerCondition enum is used in order to check if certain conditions have been met by the player.
Printable
Things that are Printable can appear in the user interface and therefore can be represented by a character in the UI.
Puddle
The puddle class represents a ground tile which may be interacted with by the player
RedWolf
The ForestKeeper class represents a type of actor in the game, specifically a hostile enemy character known as a Forest Keeper.
RedWolfSpawner
The RedWolfSpawner class is responsible for spawning a RedWolf at a given location based on weather conditions.
RefreshingFlask
The RefreshingFlask class represents an item that can be used to increase an actor's stamina in the game.
RemoveActorAction
The RemoveActorAction class represents an action that removes an Actor from the game map.
ResetAction
The ResetAction class represents an action that triggers the reset operation (global reset)
ResetManager
The ResetManager class is a singleton manager responsible for handling objects that implement the Resettable interface.
Resettable
Resettable interface that contains a reset function
Rune
The rune class represents the rune item which can be consumed by the player to increase their total balance
SellAction
The SellAction class represents an action where one actor sells a tradeable item to another actor.
SleepAction  
Spawner
The Spawner interface defines the contract for objects responsible for spawning actors in a specific location.

A class representing the Stab and Step skill action in the game.

Status
Use this enum class to represent a status.

TerrainType
An enumeration representing the grounds TerrainType.
Tradeable
The Tradeable interface defines methods that should be implemented by Tradeable items and weapons that can be traded between actors in the game.
TradeableItem
The TradeableItem class represents an item that can be traded between actors in the game.
TradeableWeapon
The TradeableWeapon class represents a weapon item that can be traded between actors in the game.
TradeType
An enumeration representing different type of transaction that can occur between player and trader.

UnlockGateAction
The UnlockGateAction class represents an action where an actor can attempt to unlock a gate.
Upgradable
The Upgradable interface defines methods that should be implemented by Upgradable items and weapons that can be upgraded by an actor.
UpgradeAction
The UpgradeAction class represents an action where one actor upgrades an upgradable item for another actor.
UpgradeType
An enumeration representing different type of items that can be upgraded.
Void
The Void class represents a deep mystery hole that can be entered by any actor but results in death if entered.

An enumeration representing different type of weather in the game.
WeatherControl
The WeatherControl class is responsible for managing the current weather conditions in the game.

World
Za Warudo! - DIO Class representing the game world, including the locations of all Actors, the player, and the playing grid.
